articles.content:
Stones donated to construction of monument in Korea
     Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Oleg Shenin, chairman of the council of the union of Communist Parties-the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, and Vladimir Tolstikov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, donated stones to the construction of the monument to the three-point charter of national reunification.

articles.content:
Korean resident in U.S. shot to death
     Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- A U.S. policeman shot to death innocent Korean resident an Jong Hwan in Nashville, Tennessee, the United States, on April 21, a Seoul-based radio reported.
   The policeman who was running about the street that day gunned down an when chasing two armed burglars who had lifted goods from his shop.    
   In this regard the "Koreans Society in Nashville" demanded a probe into the truth behind the incident, complaining that the policeman would have not shot an Jong Hwan to death if he were a white man. And local inhabitants and even U.S. media criticized the police shooting.
